    Author:
    Kee Pei Jiin

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the game. On each iteration the gameloop does the following: - add/remove Mambo Marie depending on whether Mambo Marie has already appeared in map and Mambo Marie's alive status - displays the player's map - processes the actions of every Actor in the game, regardless of map We could either only process the actors on the current map, which would make time stop on the other maps, or we could process all the actors. We chose to process all the actors.
        Overrides:
        run in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player doesn't exist

      • stillRunning

        protected boolean stillRunning()
        Returns true if the game is still running. The game is considered to still be running if the player is still around and there're still human in the maps. The game ends when the player chooses to quit game or when all the zombies including Mambo Marie were killed.
        Overrides:
        stillRunning in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World
        Returns:
        true if game is still running

      • endGameMessage

        protected java.lang.String endGameMessage()
        Return a string that can be displayed when the game ends. The string returned is based on how the game ends. If the player is killed or all humans in all maps have been killed, player loses and game is over. If all zombies in all maps and Mambo Marie are killed, player wins and game is over.
        Overrides:
        endGameMessage in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World
        Returns:
        a suitable string to be displayed when the game ends.

      • findCompoundMap

        private ZombieGameMap findCompoundMap()
        Finds the compound map object from the gameMaps list.
        Returns:
        object representing the compound map
